contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Christian leader | type = Bishop | name = Nicholas Close | title = [[Bishop of Coventry and Lichfield]] | image = | alt = | caption = | church = Catholic | archdiocese = | diocese = | see = [[Diocese of Coventry and Lichfield]] | term = 1452 | predecessor = [[William Booth (archbishop)|William Booth]] | successor = [[Reginald Boulers]] <!-- Orders --> | ordination = | ordinated_by = | consecration = | consecrated_by = | rank = <!-- Personal details --> | birth_date = | birth_place = | death_date = October 1452 | death_place = | previous_post = [[Bishop of Carlisle]]<br />[[Archdeacon of Colchester]] }} '''Nicholas Close''' (died 1452) was an English [[priest]], [[Bishop of Carlisle]] from 1450 to 1452. He was provided to the [[Episcopal see|see]] of Carlisle in January 1450, and consecrated on 15 March 1450.<ref name=Handbook236>Fryde, et al. ''Handbook of British Chronology'' p. 236</ref> He was selected [[Bishop of Lichfield|Bishop of Coventry and Lichfield]] on 30 August 1452 and served for a short time before his death in late October 1452.<ref name=Handbook254>Fryde, et al. ''Handbook of British Chronology'' p. 254</ref> He was educated at [[King's College, Cambridge]], being elected a [[fellow]] in 1443,<ref>{{Venn|id= CLS450N|name=Close, Nicholas}}</ref> and served as a commissioner to Scotland in 1449. He was [[Archdeacon of Colchester]] before being appointed bishop. ==Notes== {{reflist|2}} ==References== * {{cite book |author=Fryde, E. B. |coauthors=Greenway, D. E.; Porter, S.; Roy, I. |title=Handbook of British Chronology|edition=Third revised |publisher=Cambridge University Press |location=Cambridge |year=1996 |isbn=0-521-56350-X }} {{s-start}} {{s-rel|ca}} {{s-bef| before=[[Marmaduke Lumley]] }} {{s-ttl| title=[[Bishop of Carlisle]] | years= 1450–1452}} {{s-aft | after=[[William Percy (bishop)|William Percy]]}} {{s-bef| before=[[William Booth (archbishop)|William Booth]] }} {{s-ttl| title= [[Bishop of Lichfield|Bishop of Coventry and Lichfield]] | years=1452–1453}} {{s-aft | after=[[Reginald Boulers]]}} {{s-end}} {{Bishops of Carlisle}} {{Persondata |NAME= Close, Nicholas |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= |SHORT DESCRIPTION=Bishop of Carlisle, Bishop of Coventry and Lichfield |DATE OF BIRTH= |PLACE OF BIRTH= |DATE OF DEATH=October 1452 |PLACE OF DEATH= }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Close, Nicholas}} [[Category:Chancellors of the University of Cambridge]] [[Category:Year of birth missing]] [[Category:1452 deaths]] [[Category:English Roman Catholic priests]] [[Category:Alumni of King's College, Cambridge]] [[Category:Fellows of King's College, Cambridge]] [[Category:Bishops of Carlisle]] [[Category:Bishops of Coventry]] [[Category:Archdeacons of Colchester]] [[Category:15th-century Roman Catholic bishops]] [[Category:15th-century English people]] {{UK-bishop-stub}}
